pros: - Welcoming Environment - Great Benefits - Great Management
cons: - None, aside from normal cons associated with work in general, at any company

review_title: Not who they say they are!
pros: I enjoyed the first few months but saw quickly how difficult it was to deal with leads that weren't qualified.
cons: I'm a former employee of Sundance College. I was led to believe that there would be quality leads to convert to enrolments. Upon hiring I was led to believe that it was standard to have at least 10-15 enrolments per month with the leads we would get. I found that after a few months our leads were less, quality was less, more advisors were hired and therefore we got less leads. I found that if you weren't part of "the group" and sucked up to your supervisor you were pretty much at the bottom. We were expected on days off to make certain our new leads were contacted or they would be taken away. There was no motivation with pay that's for sure. The salary and commission were fairly low for the amount of work that would go into first of all trying to reach a lead, constant phone, email, texting to try and reach. If you couldn't reach a lead it was looked on as though you weren't trying hard enough. Once enrolled if the student didn't stay at least 60 days we don't get paid commission after all the hard work put into the enrolment. After some time spent working here I could see the writing on the wall. They hire others to replace you while still working here. I found it to be a slap in the face. They have high turnover in this Company so beware. They may say this job is not for everyone. I've got many, many years of sales experience and have never worked for a company that pays so little. Read the reviews before you fall for the talk. Employees post good reviews just to show there are good reviews!

job_title: Technical Support Engineer in Calgary, AB
cons: Not many cons come to mind

pros: Sundance is by far the best College to work for, its a professional learning/teaching company that takes care of its employees, great friendly environment to work for, whether it is the management or team, everything is amazing on all fronts to pay, benefits, and most importantly taking care of their employees. Love being a part of this Amazing Company.
cons: None at all, everything is amazing working for Sundance.

review_title: Poor Salary, No Room for Growth and Poor job security
pros: Unfortunately there are not that many pros working for Sundance College, the only one that I could think of is the relations amongst fellow colleagues.
cons: Management conditions are very poor, there is little to no communication and huge layoffs in the recent months have been made. I had high hopes for this company and things were looking bright when I first started working here, bue the true face of this company showed when low numbers were reflected.

pros: Sundance is one of the most amazing college to work for, they are kind to there employee and they are professional teaching and learning collage. I love how every one is helpful there team work is amazing and I'm loving of being a part of this great team.
cons: not at all every thing is wonderful in Sundance college.

job_title: Director, Campus Operations in Calgary, AB
pros: I’ve recently started at Sundance College and LOVE what I’ve seen so far. The focus on changing lives and student success is heartwarming. Management has a collaborative approach that is encouraging and very supportive to its employees. Work life balance is also highly valued. It’s truly an amazing place to work.
cons: No cons that I can think of

pros: growing company with lots of potential
By far the most positive work environment I have ever had the pleasure of being a part of. Everyone is so supportive of each other and genuinely wants to help students achieve their dreams.
cons: Depending on what position you have it might not be the best fit for you.

pros: Hands down, it’s always the people you work with. Michele Taha, the director of the Edmonton Campus is interested in everyone’s success (students or staff). Her execution of campus operations is stellar, but the team approach is why we all love to work here. She understands people and process, how to help with issues, how to coach, motivate and mobilize her team. I could work for her wherever she is.
cons: Weekend work once in awhile but other time is given in lieu of this. It’s fair.

job_title: Financial Aid Administrator in Calgary, AB
pros: Everyone in this department is friendly and will answer your questions at any time you need. Workplace environment is also awesome

Joining Sundance College has been a terrific experience, having been afforded the opportunity to work in a friendly and very diverse environment. While a fast-paced work place, the leadership structure is unique and balanced, while offering a supportive culture that provides for both student and staff success. Continued and steady growth over the past few years has provided opportunity for many, which is something not seen in numerous industries of late. Thankful to be a member of an evolving Sundance team.

Everyone treats each other as family. We help each other to achieve individual and group goals. If you're looking for a job that values work-life balance, this is the perfect company for you. The campus is your second home.
cons: Working in an educational institution has a lot of pressure.

pros: Many opportunities to move around within the company, great place to learn new skills, good management, supportive staff.
cons: Is a sitting job, may be hard to get used to if you are used to being on your feet all day.
